Setting General Chart Properties

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

By taking advantage of the options offered on the General tab of the Chart Properties dialog, you can change the default gallery type and other physical features that affect the appearance of your chart. Depending on the type of chart you have selected, some options may be disabled.

Many options in this dialog consist of a list box that contains icons or pictures to be selected. Placing the cursor on an icon displays a description of the icon at the bottom of the list box.

To set General chart options:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the Chart Options button on the Chart window toolbar. This action displays the Chart Properties dialog, with the General tab displayed.

  3. From the General tab, select any of the following options for your chart:

    • Gallery Type: Select a type of chart. Possible chart types include: Area, Lines, Horizontal Bars, Pie, Surface, Columns, Marks, Scatter, Doughnut, Pareto, Cubes, Fit to Curve, Hi-Lo-Close, and Polar.

    • Stacked Style: Select a type of stacking:

      • No stacking

      • Stacked

      • 100% stacked

    • Grid Lines: Select grid lines for the axis area:

      • No grid lines

      • Horizontal grid lines

      • Vertical grid lines

      • Both horizontal and vertical grid lines

    • Color Scheme: Select a color scheme for elements that accept colors:

      •  Solid colors

      •  Black-and-white patterns

      •  Color patterns

    • 3D Cluster: This check box becomes enabled when the Multiple types check box in the Series dialog is checked. Select 3D Cluster to give each series a separate depth in the chart. Clear this check box to have the series share a common area.

    • Color Lines: Select this option to make the axes the same color as the selected series.

    • Point Type: Select a shape for point markers:

      • No points

      • Triangular points

      • Variable points

      • Rectangular points

      • Spherical points

      • Circular points

      • Cubed points

    • Point Size slider: Slide to the right for larger and to the left for smaller point markers.

    • Marker Volume slider: Slide to the right for wider and to the left for thinner bars or cubes on bar and cube charts. Sliding all the way to the right makes the bars abut.

  4. After making your selections, click Apply to apply your settings without closing the dialog. Moving to another tab is equivalent to clicking Apply.

  5. To close the dialog, click OK.
